input_text.Prompt:
Product name:
Wayne SWS50-12P 1/2 hp Shallow Well Jet Pump Conventional 12 gallon Tank System

Product keywords:
1/2 hp cast iron shallow well jet pump conventional tank system with 12 gallon horizontal tank
1/2 hp; max. Flow rate is 420 gallons per hour; (50 psi)
3/4 in. Npt discharge with 1-1/4 in. Suction
Dual voltage (120V/240V) high efficiency square flange motor (factory set for 240V)
Pressure switch is pre-set at 30-50 psi for automatic operation
Assembled in US with foreign and domestic parts
Durable cast iron volute with dedicated priming port for volute filling. For wells 0 ft. - 25 ft. in depth.

Product description:
input_text.Response A:
This Wayne SWS50-12P 1/2 hp Shallow Well Jet Pump Conventional 12 gallon Tank System is designed for residential water systems and has a 12 gallon tank. It is a compact and powerful pump that can deliver up to 420 gallons of water per hour. This 1/2 hp jet pump has a cast iron volute that is durable and can easily be primed. It comes with a 1-1/4 in. suction and 3/4 in. NPT discharge. This jet pump is equipped with an automatic pressure switch that can be adjusted between 30 and 50 psi. It is a dual voltage pump (120V/240V) that has a high efficiency square flange motor. This jet pump is also rust-resistant and can be used with wells that are up to 25 ft. deep. This conventional shallow well jet pump comes with a 1 yr. limited warranty.

Product review:
This Wayne SWS50-12P 1/2 hp Shallow Well Jet Pump Conventional 12 gallon Tank System is a great product for residential water systems. It is easy to install and comes with a powerful motor that can deliver up to 420 gallons of water per hour. The cast iron volute is durable and can easily be primed. The pressure switch is adjustable and can be set to shut off at 30-50 psi. This jet pump is equipped with a high efficiency square flange motor that is dual voltage and can be used with wells that are up to 25 ft. deep. It also comes with a 1 yr. limited warranty. Overall, this is a great product that is highly recommended.

Cons:
